description:
Tree Works in the Bunhill Fields and Finsbury Conservation Area
To carry out multiple works to trees located in the grounds, as follows:-
T12 - Plane: Reduce limbs, raise crowns of young trees by 3 metres
T15 - Ash: Fell x 3 adjacent to magnolia
T16 - Ash: Remove deadwood
T29 - Plane: Reduce limbs on eastern side by 4-5 metres
T34 - Plane: Reduce lowest limbs on eastern side by 3-4 metres
T32 - Lime: Crown raise to first fork
T48 - Lime: Crown raise to first fork
T44 - Cypress: Remove 1 x leader
T123 - Plane: Raise canopy and clear lamp
T129 - Oak: Fell to ground level
T111 - Ash: Remove deadwood and stubbs, deadwood small adjacent Oak
T109 - Oak: Raise canopy and deadwood, deadwood adjacent Oak
T110 - Plane: Remove epicormics and raise canopy
T108 - Plane: Remove low limbs and raise canopy
T109 - Oak: Raise canopy and remove deadwood
T87 - Plane: Raise crown by 2 metres and remove low limb over road
T88 - Holly: Raise canopy
T84 - Oak: Raise canopy over road and cut back from building
T61 - Oak: Raise canopy over road and cut back from building
T59 - Oak: Cut back from building and remove deadwood
T66 - Lime: Fell smallest in group and raise crowns on others
T59 - Ash: Remove deadwood
T72 - Oak: Cut back for alarm beam and remove deadwood
T73 - Ash: Reduce crown by 30%
T74 - Oak: Cut back and remove deadwood
T75 - Oak: Fell to ground level
T77 - Plane: Reduce back from building
T82 - Oak: Remove deadwood, and raise crowns to adjacent trees

Note: All crown raises (crown lifts) are to statutory heights for health and safety
